Acrid Scattershot.name: Acrid Scattershot
Acrid Scattershot.description:
Ammunition Firearm

Activate a Interact

An acrid scattershot can only be used by a scatter weapon. Make a @Check[type:flat|dc:5|showDC:all].

Critical Success As success but the gas lasts for 3 rounds.

Success Any creatures damaged by the scatter trait of the triggering strike are exposed to an acrid, toxic gas that lasts for 1 round, after which the gas dissipates. Any creature within this area must make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|showDC:all] saving throw, taking [[/r {1d6}[persistent,poison]]]  @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Poison Damage} and becoming @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 1} on a failure, and taking [[/r {2d6}[persistent,poison]]]  @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Poison Damage} and becoming @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure.

Failure The effects of the ammunition do not activate, but the strike goes as normal.

Critical Failure As success, but the cartridge releases the gas too early, only aecting you instead of any creature damaged by the scatter trait.

Buckler Pistol.name: Buckler Pistol
Buckler Pistol.description: This small double-barreled pistol is designed to be attached to a buckler and can be fired with the wielder’s other hand. Despite being double-barreled, the pistol cannot fire both barrels at once.

Cattleman Revolver.name: Cattleman Revolver
Cattleman Revolver.description: A lightweight and easy to use single-action revolver. Found most often in the hands of ranchers and farmhands, this weapon is simple to operate, simple to clean and repair, and a solid option for defending against feral wildlife or ne'er-do-wells.

Combat Shotgun.name: Combat Shotgun
Combat Shotgun.description: The click-clack of a shotshell being loaded into a combat shotgun is one that is sure to put fear into anyone who stands in your way. A refined cousin of the blunderbuss, the shotgun is a tube-fed firearm seen most commonly in either pump-action or lever-action configurations. When loaded with shotshells, cylindrical rounds filled with gunpowder and metal beads, these weapons are devastating at closer ranges, while still being able to pack a moderate punch from a distance. Combat Shotgun Magazines contain 4 shells.

Culverin.name: Culverin
Culverin.description: This small double-barreled pistol is designed to be attached to a buckler and can be fired with the wielder’s other hand. Despite being double-barreled, the pistol cannot fire both barrels at once.

Double-Action Revolver.name: Double-Action Revolver
Double-Action Revolver.description: One of the more advanced pieces of Arcadian firearm design yet crafted, this revolver features a double-action trigger, meaning that each time the trigger is pulled, the hammer moves backwards on it’s own and rotates the cylinder before slamming forwards and ring any round in the chamber. This design allows for much faster ring than a single-action revolver, and is incredibly simple to use; just point and squeeze, and whatever you pointed at won’t be standing for much longer. You may use the Interact action required to select the next loaded chamber after firing this weapon (as per the description of the Capacity trait) as a free action.

Double-Barreled Shotgun.name: Double-Barreled Shotgun
Double-Barreled Shotgun.description: This breech-loaded breakaction scattergun is easy to clean and repair thanks to its mechanical simplicity, and is an excellent choice for defending your homestead from troublemakers

Duckfoot Pistol (Single).name: Duckfoot Pistol (Single)
Duckfoot Pistol (Single).description:
This firearm has four barrels arranged in a fan-shaped group, resulting in an overall shape similar to that of a duck’s webbed foot, which can either fire a single shot or a 4-shot volley in a similar manner to a double-barreled firearm with a simple switching of an adjustable flintlock. When congured to fire a single shot, this weapon deals 1d4 piercing damage, has a range of 60 feet, and gains the Fatal d8 trait. When congured to fire in a volley, this weapon has a damage die relative to the amount of ammunition loaded into the weapon (1d4 for 1 or 2 rounds, 1d6 for 3 or 4 rounds), has a range of 40 feet, and gains the Scatter 10 ft. trait. When used in its volley conguration, this weapon uses all ammunition loaded into the weapon.

Other Configurations: @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.sPJkGcvovrJN6fT9]{Duckfoot Pistol (Volley: 1-2)} @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.6hW4PKATV2uk5vBD]{Duckfoot Pistol (Volley: 3-4)}

Erratic Bullet.name: Erratic Bullet
Erratic Bullet.description:
Ammunition firearm

Activate a Interact

Your bullet homes in on the target, no matter how it’s trying to conceal itself, and bounces around erratically until it finds said target. The shot ignores the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} conditions as well as lesser and normal cover.

Frontier Repeater.name: Frontier Repeater
Frontier Repeater.description: The rifle of choice for frontiersmen all across Arcadia, this lever-action tube-fed repeater rifle is chambered in a large-bore rifle round powerful enough to bring down anything you might run into while roaming the wilderness. Frontier Repeater magazines contain 5 bullets.

Grapeshot Revolver (Revolver).name: Grapeshot Revolver (Revolver)
Grapeshot Revolver (Revolver).description:
A single-action ball-and-cap revolver that is quite unusual for two reasons; one being the high capacity of the cylinder at 9 rounds, the other being the underbarrel shotgun capable of holding one shell, usually loaded with grapeshot for it’s effectiveness at extreme close quarters as a result of the higher amount of spread, hence the moniker of “Grapeshot Revolver” . With this weapon, the wielder can swap between a precise and powerful revolver and a devastating close-quarters shot with a flick of a finger. Very few of these revolvers exist, a sizeable portion of which are early prototypes. When used in its revolver configuration, this weapon deals 1d6 piercing damage, has a range of 70 feet, and gains the Fatal d10 trait. When used in its shotgun conguration, this weapon deals 1d8 piercing damage, has a range of 10 feet, and gains the Scatter 5 ft. trait.

 

Transforms into @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.IyXov7P8KsyhQbQ2]{Grapeshot Revolver (Shotgun)}

Grapeshot Revolver (Shotgun).name: Grapeshot Revolver (Shotgun)
Grapeshot Revolver (Shotgun).description:

With this weapon, the wielder can swap between a precise and powerful revolver and a devastating close-quarters shot with a flick of a finger. Gravewalker Revolver.name: Gravewalker Revolver
Gravewalker Revolver.description: Sometimes called “the bigger brother of the Pocket Dragoon” , this large-caliber percussion cap revolver shares many of the same design decisions and abilities, such as the cylinder-swapping capability, with its smaller counterpart, with the added benefit of being a veritable hand cannon (albeit only in a metaphorical sense). Wielding this weapon with two hands qualies as stabilizing the weapon for the purposes of negating any penalties from the Kickback trait.

Gunslinging Bullet.name: Gunslinging Bullet
Gunslinging Bullet.description:
Ammunition firearm

Activate a Interact

When fired, this bullet stops in mid-air and draws 2 smaller firearms, firing both at once at the target of the original strike. If the strike hits, the damage dice is doubled, but is reduced by one die size

Lasso.name: Lasso
Lasso.description: A 20 to 30-foot length of heavy, stirope with a loop at one end tied in a manner that allows tightening around anything it is wrapped around. Commonly used by ranchers to guide and restrain cattle, typically by tossing the loop over the neck or horns of the animal. Using a single @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} action to begin spinning the loop around allows the wielder to throw the heavy loop roughly twice as far with the assistance of centrifugal force, increasing the range of the lasso’s thrown trait to 25 feet. You can’t spin the lasso’s loop underwater. Keeping the loop spinning requires a free action each round, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits. You can keep the loop spinning as an exploration activity, but doing so for more than 10 minutes makes you fatigued, similarly to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JuqmIAnkL9hVGai8]{Hustling}.

Lupara.name: Lupara
Lupara.description: “Lupara” is a colloquial term for double-barreled shotguns that have had their barrels and buttstocks cut down as much as possible to create a devastating weapon, albeit with a very specic use-case; extreme close quarters combat. The cut-down barrel of this weapon drastically increases the spread of each shot fired, making the weapon nearly unusable at longer ranges, but excellent at tearing enemies limb from limb at point-blank range. When wielding this weapon in one hand, the Strength requirement listed in the Kickback trait is increased to 16. Wielding this weapon with two hands qualies as stabilizing the weapon for the purposes of negating any penalties from the Kickback trait.

Machine Gun.name: Machine Gun
Machine Gun.description:
Ammunition: @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.7x4ELp6gDveDEbRO]{Machine Gun Belts} (65gp, 1 bulk)

Usage: Portable (Black Powder), held in 2-4 hands; Bulk: 5; Proficiency: Martial

A man-portable machine gun with a bolt operated by recoil and a barrel cooled with water. Commonly used within machine-gunner crews of 2 and planted rmly on the ground with a receiver-mounted tripod or a barrel-mounted bipod, a gunner and their assistant gunner can make short work of enemies with a bit of coordination and a well-aimed hail of bullets.

Aim: a @Template[type:line|distance:45] originating from one of the wielders

Load: 2 (manipulate), 2 times, removes and clears debris from any previous belt and loads a new 90-round ammunition belt

Launch: a (manipulate, concussive) [[/r {8d6 piercing}]], @Template[type:line|distance:45], @Check[type:reflex|dc:25|showDC:all|basic:true]. Each launch consumes 30 rounds of ammunition from the 90-round belt

Machine Gun Belts.name: Machine Gun Belts
Machine Gun Belts.description: This 90-round belt is good for 3 launches of a @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.8Kg79Me8Wr6m8OkD]{Machine Gun}

Magazine (Combat Shotgun).name: Magazine (Combat Shotgun)
Magazine (Combat Shotgun).description: Firearms require ammunition consisting of a projectile and black powder. A round of ammo can vary in its composition but is typically either a prepackaged paper cartridge, including wadding, bullet, and black powder, or loose shot packed in manually. Some weapons, like hand cannons and blunderbusses, can fire other materials, but their ammunition has the same Price due to the cost of the black powder. Because making rounds of firearm ammunition requires creating black powder, you need the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} skill feat to make them. Firearm rounds are a valid option for magical ammunition, just like arrows or bolts. Crafting magical firearm ammunition requires you to be able to craft both alchemical and magical items.

Mare's Leg.name: Mare's Leg
Mare's Leg.description: This modied frontier repeater features a cut down barrel, tube magazine, and buttstock to reduce the overall length and weight of the weapon, and a larger loop on the cocking lever, both modifications lending the weapon well to being fired and cocked with one hand. When used in one hand, the weapon’s action is cycled with a technique dubbed “spin-cocking” , a maneuver that takes advantage of the larger lever loop on the mare’s leg to allow the wielder to spin the weapon with the lever with only one hand, using mostly centrifugal force to cycle the weapon's action.

Pocket Dragoon.name: Pocket Dragoon
Pocket Dragoon.description: This percussion cap revolver is commonly carried by cavalry soldiers as a sidearm, and is valued for its reliability, solid stopping power relative to its compact size, and the ability to remove and replace entire cylinders instead of manually reloading in a matter of seconds.

Pom-Pom Gun.name: Pom-Pom Gun
Pom-Pom Gun.description:
Ammunition: @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.p8wudi5vQfDRaObJ]{Pom-Pom Gun Belts} (125gp, 5 bulk)

Usage: Mounted (Black Powder); Space 10 feet long, 6 feet high, 5 feet wide @Template[type:line|distance:10]; Crew 2-4; Proficiency: Martial

AC: 28; Fort: [[/r 1d20+24]]; Ref: [[/r 1d20+17]]

Hardness: 18; HP: 135; Immunities: object immunities

The name “Pom-Pom Gun ” refers to the “POM! POM! POM!” of this watercooled, fully-automatic cannon firing, although a more formal name for it would be “Explosive Autocannon ”. When loaded with the standard 1.5-inch diameter self-contained explosive shells, the pom-pom gun can fire devastating explosive payloads at impressive distances. In addition, the weapon only requires a modest crew of two people— one to rotate the crank wheels used to aim the weapon, and another to assist the sometimes inconsistent feeding of the 15-round ammunition belts. The pom-pom gun is especially geared towards shooting down air or water-borne craft.

Aim: 2 45 feet, minimum distance 90 feet

Load: 2 (manipulate), 2 times, removes and clears debris from any previous belt and loads a new 15-round ammunition belt

Launch: a (manipulate, range increment 125 feet) [[/r {8d10}[ bludgeoning]]], @Template[type:burst|distance:20], @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|showDC:all|basic:true]

Pom-Pom Gun Belts.name: Pom-Pom Gun Belts
Pom-Pom Gun Belts.description: This 15-round belt is good for one launch of a @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.jH4ZdIOKyw2iBZYO]{Pom-Pom Gun}

Repeater Carbine.name: Repeater Carbine
Repeater Carbine.description: This short-barreled lever-action carbine offers decent stopping power in a compact package, and has a removable tube magazine stored in the buttstock of the weapon that can store up to 7 rounds.

Rolling Block Rifle.name: Rolling Block Rifle
Rolling Block Rifle.description:
A powerful, mechanically unique single-shot rifle meant for long-range precision shooting, making it an excellent choice for taking out important gures on a battleeld from extreme distances. The complex split-breech construction of this weapon allows the usage of high-powered rounds, while still keeping the weapon fairly light and easy to aim in trained hands, albeit with the added difficulty of reloading a weapon with this level of complexity.

Foundry Note: This weapon should have a range increment of 200 feet, but the pf2e system as of this writing doesn't support that specific value.

Rotary Gun.name: Rotary Gun
Rotary Gun.description:
Ammunition: @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.srdpm1O24o5KCR1e]{Rotary Gun Magaziness} (35gp, 2 bulk)

Usage: Mounted (Black Powder); Space 6 feet long, 4 feet high, 5 feet wide @Template[type:line|distance:6]; Crew 1-4; Proficiency: Martial

AC: 22; Fort: [[/r 1d20+17]]; Ref: [[/r 1d20+11]]

Hardness: 16; HP: 75; Immunities: object immunities

A rapid-ring mounted rearm with between 6 and 10 barrels mounted to a manually-cranked rotating chassis. Each barrel fires any ammunition loaded into it when it reaches a set position on the weapon and ejects any leftover casings as it rotates back around. Ammunition is fed into the weapon via a top-mounted magazine with a standard capacity of around 40 self-contained brass cartridges. The weapon itself is usually put on the back of a cart or is mounted to two large wheels and a leg to stabilize on, allowing it to be carted around similarly to a wheelbarrow.

Aim: 2 Rotate 45 degrees

Load: 2 (manipulate), 2 times, removes and clears debris from any previous belt and loads a new 40-round ammunition belt

Launch: a (manipulate, concussive) [[/r {10d6}[piercing]]], @Template[type:line|distance:60|width:10], @Check[type:reflex|dc:24|showDC:all|basic:true]. Each launch consumes 10 rounds of ammunition from the 40-round magazine.

Rotary Gun Magazines.name: Rotary Gun Magazines
Rotary Gun Magazines.description: These 40-round magazines are good for 4 launches of a @Compendium[pf2e-gunsmoke.gunsmoke-equipment.yBD5NJ6Yx0lKgqSN]{Rotary Gun}

Because making rounds of firearm ammunition requires creating black powder, you need the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} skill feat to make them. Firearm rounds are a valid option for magical ammunition, just like arrows or bolts. Crafting magical firearm ammunition requires you to be able to craft both alchemical and magical items.

Rubber Bullet.name: Rubber Bullet
Rubber Bullet.description: This bullet is fully made of rubber, rendering it extremely painful, but not destructive enough to accidentally blow someone ’ s leg off. On a successful strike, any damage dealt with this ammunition is considered non lethal. Strikes made with rubber bullets cannot benefit from the deadly, fatal, fatal aim, or scatter traits.

Sassy Bullet.name: Sassy Bullet
Sassy Bullet.description:
Ammunition firearm

Activate a Interact

This bullet carries with it a scalding hot tongue, observing and insulting the target with deep-cutting words, the content of which is decided by you out of character. If your Strike was a success, the target is caught off guard by the insult and takes a –2 status penalty to Perception and Will saves for 1 minute. The target can end the effect early with a retort to the bullet’s insult, which requires a single action with the concentrate trait or an appropriate skill action that could effectively retort the bullet’s words. The GM determines which skill actions qualify, though they must take at least 1 action. Typically, the retort needs to use a linguistic Charisma-based skill action. On a critical success, this status penalty increases to a -3.

Screaming Bullet.name: Screaming Bullet
Screaming Bullet.description: This intricately crafted bullet has a few perfectly placed holes and tubes within it, allowing it to make an incredibly loud sound of blood-curdling screaming as it travels through the air. When activated, if you make a strike with a firearm loaded with this ammunition, a target of your choice within 60 feet must make a @Check[type:will|dc:20|showDC:all] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 1}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure.

Semi-Automatic Pistol.name: Semi-Automatic Pistol
Semi-Automatic Pistol.description: One of a rumored trio of sem-iauto prototype weapons created as a collaborative effort between several of Golarion’s finest gunsmiths, this pistol features a mag-fed semi-automatic recoil-operated firing system capable of firing as fast as the user can pull the trigger. This weapon is chambered in small pistol rounds, lending to its ease of use and very light felt recoil. Typical magazines for the semi-automatic pistol can contain up to 10 rounds of ammunition.

Semi-Automatic Rifle.name: Semi-Automatic Rifle
Semi-Automatic Rifle.description: One of a rumored trio of prototype semi-auto weapon lines created as a collaborative effort between several of Golarion’s fonest gunsmiths, this rifle’s bolt is cycled with the recoil of each round fired, removing any need to manually cycle the action before firing another shot. The blazing speed at which this weapon can be fired combined with the decent stopping power of its rounds will eat through this weapon’s 8-round en-bloc clip while punching straight through anything you’re aiming at.

Semi-Automatic Shotgun.name: Semi-Automatic Shotgun
Semi-Automatic Shotgun.description: One of a rumored trio of prototype semi-auto weapon lines created as a collaborative effort between several of Golarion’s finest gunsmiths, this shotgun can fire at blazing fast speeds thanks to its recoil-operated semi-auto construction, capable of firing several devastating shotshells back to back, most likely ripping any target to shreds in a matter of seconds. Semi-Automatic Shotgun magazines contain 4 shells.

Trapper's Knife.name: Trapper's Knife
Trapper's Knife.description: A large fighting knife with a sturdy, single-edged, cleaver-like blade with a row of serrations near the hilt. While designed to be used as a close-quarters fighting knife or mounted to the barrel of a rifle as a bayonet, over time this weapon evolved into a knife more geared towards use by trappers, survivalists, and frontiersmen on the continent of Arcadia. Chopping away brush, cutting down small trees, and skinning animals are a few of the things this weapon is perfect for. Commonly carried in decorative sheaths made of the leather of rare or dangerous animals as a status symbol.

Varmint Rifle.name: Varmint Rifle
Varmint Rifle.description: A tube-fed rie found most often in pump-action, lever-action, and bolt-action iterations chambered in small, high-velocity rounds that offer excellent precision in trained hands, but are lacking in stopping power. Meant primarily for hunting small game, though it will still kill larger targets, such as wolves, deer, or even people with some precision. Varmint Rifle magazines contain 10 bullets.
